update.description:
This pull request changes queueing functionality such that segway queues a shell file containing the to-be-queued arguments, instead of queueing the arguments themselves.

As a quick/rough example, rather than sending 'software/gmtkEMtrain [params]' to DRMAA to run, segway will send the path to a shell file 'emt0.0.0.uuid.sh' to DRMAA to run, where 'emt0.0.0.uuid.sh' contains 'software/gmtkEMtrain [params]'.

Shell files will be placed in the file system as follows:


```
#!python

traindir
    cmdline
        0 # instance number
            emt0.0.0.uuid.sh
    log
    ...etc...

identifydir
    cmdline
        identify
            vit.uuid.sh
    log
    ...etc...
```



This is to fix [issue 72](#!/hoffmanlab/segway/issues/72/segway-on-sge-does-not-submit-job).

Triangulation is ignored since it is locally run, not submitted through DRMAA.

All tests have been changed to accommodate for the additional shell files. I have verified that they all pass locally.

Argument parameters are also now double-quotation-mark escaped, to ensure they can be run with bash. run.sh and details.sh in the traindir/identifydir for every test has been changed to accommodate for this.

One thing I was not sure about was what permissions to give the shell file segway creates. By default I set permissions to be 0775 (octal) but I am not sure if this should be changed.

I've also tested this on a large run (list of windows > 1024 chars) that previously failed, and it successfully passes bundling to continue into the next round.
update.title: Change queueing functionality such that segway queues a shell file containing the to-be-queued arguments, instead of queueing the arguments themselves

pull_request.title: Change queueing functionality such that segway queues a shell file containing the to-be-queued arguments, instead of queueing the arguments themselves

update.description:
This pull request changes queueing functionality such that segway queues a shell file containing the to-be-queued arguments, instead of queueing the arguments themselves.

As a quick/rough example, rather than sending 'software/gmtkEMtrain [params]' to DRMAA to run, segway will send the path to a shell file 'emt0.0.0.uuid.sh' to DRMAA to run, where 'emt0.0.0.uuid.sh' contains 'software/gmtkEMtrain [params]'.

Shell files will be placed in the file system as follows:


```
#!python

traindir
    cmdline
        0 # instance number
            emt0.0.0.uuid.sh
    log
    ...etc...

identifydir
    cmdline
        identify
            vit.uuid.sh
    log
    ...etc...
```



This is to fix [issue 72](#!/hoffmanlab/segway/issues/72/segway-on-sge-does-not-submit-job).

Triangulation is ignored since it is locally run, not submitted through DRMAA.

All tests have been changed to accommodate for the additional shell files. I have verified that they all pass locally.

Argument parameters are also now double-quotation-mark escaped, to ensure they can be run with bash. run.sh and details.sh in the traindir/identifydir for every test has been changed to accommodate for this.

One thing I was not sure about was what permissions to give the shell file segway creates. By default I set permissions to be 0775 (octal) but I am not sure if this should be changed.

I've also tested this on a large run (list of windows > 1024 chars) that previously failed, and it successfully passes bundling to continue into the next round.
update.title: Change queueing functionality such that segway queues a shell file containing the to-be-queued arguments, instead of queueing the arguments themselves

pullrequest.title: Change queueing functionality such that segway queues a shell file containing the to-be-queued arguments, instead of queueing the arguments themselves

content.raw: This should be a constant at the top level of the file. Should not have group write permission. Also construct in terms of these bitmasks imported from the `stat` module: `S_IREAD | S_IEXEC | S_IWUSR`
content.html: This should be a constant at the top level of the file. Should not have group write permission. Also construct in terms of these bitmasks imported from the stat module: S_IREAD | S_IEXEC | S_IWUSR

pullrequest.title: Change queueing functionality such that segway queues a shell file containing the to-be-queued arguments, instead of queueing the arguments themselves

content.raw: There are a lot of corner cases where this will fail. (For example, if there's a double quote in an argument.) Use [`pipes.quote()`](https://docs.python.org/2/library/pipes.html#pipes.quote) with a comment to change to `shlex.quote()` when we move to Python 3.
content.html: There are a lot of corner cases where this will fail. (For example, if there's a double quote in an argument.) Use pipes.quote() with a comment to change to shlex.quote() when we move to Python 3.

pullrequest.title: Change queueing functionality such that segway queues a shell file containing the to-be-queued arguments, instead of queueing the arguments themselves

content.raw:
Yes, it's only ever called once, in:

```
#!python

def _log_cmdline(logfile, cmdline):
    print >>logfile, " ".join(map(quote_spaced_str, cmdline))

```
in run.py.

The purpose of the function was to add quotation marks only around arguments that had spaces in them (for example, ```"-DCARD_SEG=4 -DINPUT_PARAMS_FILENAME=traindir/params/params.0.params.1 -DCARD_FRAMEINDEX=200000 -DSEGTRANSITION_WEIGHT_SCALE=1.0 -DCARD_SUBSEG=1"```), however now we want quotation marks around all arguments. It seemed cleaner to me to simply modify this function, rather than add a function that would both detect arguments already with quotation marks, and then apply quotation marks if not.
content.html:
Yes, it's only ever called once, in:

def _log_cmdline(logfile, cmdline):
    print >>logfile, " ".join(map(quote_spaced_str, cmdline))

in run.py.

The purpose of the function was to add quotation marks only around arguments that had spaces in them (for example, "-DCARD_SEG=4 -DINPUT_PARAMS_FILENAME=traindir/params/params.0.params.1 -DCARD_FRAMEINDEX=200000 -DSEGTRANSITION_WEIGHT_SCALE=1.0 -DCARD_SUBSEG=1"), however now we want quotation marks around all arguments. It seemed cleaner to me to simply modify this function, rather than add a function that would both detect arguments already with quotation marks, and then apply quotation marks if not.

content.raw: This essentially changes the name of the function (as in "spaced" is not necessary). Where else is this called? Are you sure this change doesn't potentially break other pieces of code?

content.raw: Note that instead of passing the argument as a string (as it did when the arguments were 'gmtkEMtrain [params]', this passes the argument as a path (the paths to output files (those contained in the output/o/ directory) are also passed as a path, not a string)).
content.html: Note that instead of passing the argument as a string (as it did when the arguments were 'gmtkEMtrain [params]', this passes the argument as a path (the paths to output files (those contained in the output/o/ directory) are also passed as a path, not a string)).

update.description:
This pull request changes queueing functionality such that segway queues a shell file containing the to-be-queued arguments, instead of queueing the arguments themselves.

As a quick/rough example, rather than sending 'software/gmtkEMtrain [params]' to DRMAA to run, segway will send the path to a shell file 'emt0.0.0.uuid.sh' to DRMAA to run, where 'emt0.0.0.uuid.sh' contains 'software/gmtkEMtrain [params]'.

Shell files will be placed in the file system as follows:


```
#!python

traindir
    cmdline
        0 # instance number
            emt0.0.0.uuid.sh
    log
    ...etc...

identifydir
    cmdline
        identify
            vit.uuid.sh
    log
    ...etc...
```



This is to fix [issue 72](#!/hoffmanlab/segway/issues/72/segway-on-sge-does-not-submit-job).

Triangulation is ignored since it is locally run, not submitted through DRMAA.

All tests have been changed to accommodate for the additional shell files. I have verified that they all pass locally.

Argument parameters are also now double-quotation-mark escaped, to ensure they can be run with bash. run.sh and details.sh in the traindir/identifydir for every test has been changed to accommodate for this.

One thing I was not sure about was what permissions to give the shell file segway creates. By default I set permissions to be 0775 (octal) but I am not sure if this should be changed.

I've also tested this on a large run (list of windows > 1024 chars) that previously failed, and it successfully passes bundling to continue into the next round.
